DataElement.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Radiation Therapy Dose Reduced At Primary Tumor Site Participant Qualify Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator that specifies whether or not the participant qualifies for radiation therapy dose reduction at primary site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Radiation Therapy Dose Reduced At Primary Tumor Site Participant Qualify
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount._Used to indicate position, location, or state._The anatomic location of a primary tumor._Someone who takes part in an activity._Success in satisfying a test or requirement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Dose Reduced At Primary Tumor Site Participant Qualifying
Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount._Used to indicate position, location, or state._The anatomic location of a primary tumor._Someone who takes part in an activity._Success in satisfying a test or requirement.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount.
Used to indicate position, location, or state.
The anatomic location of a primary tumor.
Someone who takes part in an activity.
Success in satisfying a test or requirement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
